item.title: Homework

Homework Due Assignment 1 2025-09-12 Homework 1 – ggplot2 & Regression 2 2025-09-29 Homework 2 – Classification 3 2025-10-10 Homework 3 – Cross Validation 4 2025-10-27 Homework 4 – Regularization and Model Selection 5 2025-11-17 Homework 5 – Non-linear and Tree-Based Models 6 2025-12-05 Homework 6 – Support Vector Machines

item.title: Project
item.description: The goal of the project is to use the methods we have learned in class and extend our knowledge in groups. Below is an example of a project description. If your group has an alternative proposal, please schedule time to discuss with me prior to the proposal due date. One example project is to compete in a Kaggle competition (https://www.kaggle.com/competitions). If you choose to compete in a Kaggle competition, I want you to submit an answer and include your ranking in your final paper, in addition to a discussion of how you tackled the problem.

item.title: Project
item.description: The goal of the project is to use the methods we have learned in class and extend our knowledge in smaller groups. Below is an example of a project description. If your group has an alternative proposal, please schedule time to discuss with me prior to the proposal due date. One example project is to first to identify an article in the scientific/statistical literature that reports on a Monte Carlo study that was conducted to evaluate a statistical method.

item.title: Syllabus
item.description: Course Objectives Statistical Learning refers to a set of tools for modeling and understanding complex datasets. The area combines knowledge from statistics and computer science to tackle these “big data” problems and has become a popular area of work. By end of course, students will be able to: Formulate prediction problems as statistical machine learning problems (classification, regression, clustering). Choose and apply the appropriate learning methods to their data. Conduct well thought-out statistical machine learning experiments and interpret the results.
